answers.q: buying caustic soda, how to use it to dissolve alum
answers.a: E521 (aluminium sodium sulphate, “alum”) is readily soluble in plain water; you don’t need caustic soda, and mixing it with sodium hydroxide can cause an alkaline reaction and is not appropriate for food use.

answers.q: cinema modeoff how to repair a 12 volt battery for under 5 dollars using alum and baking soda
answers.a: E521 is a food-grade leavening acid used in baking powders and water treatment, not intended for battery repair; using “alum” in lead–acid batteries is unsafe and not recommended.

answers.q: dell dimension e521 how remove a firewire pci card
answers.a: E521 here refers to aluminium sodium sulphate, a food additive used as an acid in baking powder, and is unrelated to computer hardware.

answers.q: dell dimension e521 when to replace battery
answers.a: E521 is the EU code for aluminium sodium sulphate, a food additive, not a device model, so it has nothing to do with batteries.

answers.q: e521 how to know if a comic is updated
answers.a: E521 denotes aluminium sodium sulphate in the EU additives list and isn’t related to comics or apps; I can help with its food uses or safety if needed.
